title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 02
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: The executioners were preparing to perform their office, when Agnes, orMuckle-mouthed Meg, as she was called, came forth, with a deep veilthrown over her face, and sinking on her knee before the old knight,said, imploringly--"A boon, dear faither--yer dochter begs a simpleboon."

title: Rambles with an American,
author: [Jacques, Edward Tyrell]
snippet: " I've got a note about that ; but I can't remember what it is," he whispered, when the guide was drawing attention to the picture of Muckle-mouthed Meg ; and a little later I saw him in the background peering into an open pocket-book The light was somewhat dim ; and as he stood with the book close to his eyes, he looked like some good priest wholly absorbed in the study of his breviary.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: "Well, well, Muckle," he said, "you may leave CaptainEmrys to me now—we have a good deal to talk overtogether."

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: " You here, Muckle ?" said the minister, as he cameforward.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: Muckle I doubtthe sacred vollum is strange to yere sight—heavy is the wyteo't to thae that misguided ye; but gif I'm sae happy as tosee mysel' an instrument to lead ye back to the fold, theproper lights o' guidance, as approvit o' the Synod constitute,sail be obtained ye frae Mr. Bindweel Raxcauf, prenter an'vendor o' pure literature in Wullie Waters' Close, an' whaat my recommend wad admit ye to the privilege o' a pennyin the pund Scots cash remit.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: " Muckle wad Irejoice to turn ye to my Master, in contriteness an' humbleness o' spirit.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: Only a minute elapsed before a firmerfootfall approached; the door reopened, and a manappeared, in whom Emrys recognized Mr. Finlayson'sworthy henchman and factotum, Muldrup Muckle.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: Emrys followed, after addressing a word ortwo of acknowledgment to Muldrup Muckle, which thatindividual received with a grunt, and, going out into thestreet, watched the retreating figures of the unwelcomevisitors with an air of undiminished suspicion.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: " And what for may it be you speer ?" asked the suspicious Muckle.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: Stand back from me, fellow," he added, as Muldrup Muckleevinced a disposition to enter on an inspection of his personby the light of the taper.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: Emrysrecognized in him the person, solemn in visage, speech,and deportment, who had received him on his earlier visitto the house, Muldrup Muckle.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: Emrys retired humbly from the stately and sanctimoniouspresence of Muldrup Muckle, and turned his steps to theresidence of the reverend gentleman to whom so fair acharacter had been assigned.

title: Renegade. A novel
author: Chalmers, James
snippet: The smile that otherwise might have appeared on Emrys'face withered beneath the shadow of Muldrup Muckle'sportentous solemnity.
